Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

The U.S. Just Hit China With New Tariffs. Why Should Thailandâ€™s IT Industry Care?This week, the U.S. rolled out fresh tariffs on key Chinese exportsâ€”EVs, batteries, green tech, and strategic components.While the headlines focus on geopolitics, the ripple effect reaches deeper into Thailandâ€™s IT and tech economy.Hereâ€™s how:1. Pressure on Supply Chains = New IT DemandsWith higher costs on components and tech infrastructure sourced from China, Thai companies will need to:Reroute supply chainsReconfigure ERP systems and integrationsInvest in real-time data visibilityThis means rising demand for IT consultants, system architects, cloud migration experts, and cybersecurity pros.2. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

DevOps and Cloud Labs is hiring for 2 DevOps and Cloud Engineers.To apply:- Please send your cv to rahulmagoo2003@gmail.com- Join WhatsApp Group : https://lnkd.in/gCBSPhUT- Reply a 1-2 line summary of your profile in comments so I can look at your profile. Include years of experience, and rate yourself in DevOps(x/10) and AWS(x/10) Azure(x/10).For shortlisted candidates, Interviews expected to be scheduled around 5 April onwards. Work experience letter will be provided as it is a full time position with an expected tenure of 6 months or more for the right candidate.- Remote WFH, flexible hours- DevOps knowledge- AWS/Azure knowledge. Any one cloud is enough.- Freshers with a work dedicated attitude and with basic DevOps/AWS knowledge are welcome to apply as well.Thank you for your interest.

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. HR Screening: Phone interview with basic technical questions (recorded for tech team review).2. Technical Interview: In-depth assessment with the tech team.---Why Join Us?Competitive salary and benefits.Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology in the cryptocurrency industry.Collaborative and innovative work environment.Career growth and professional development opportunities.CV send via email: lan.nguyen@metasolutions.software

The U.S. Just Hit China With New Tariffs. Why Should Thailandâ€™s IT Industry Care?This week, the U.S. rolled out fresh tariffs on key Chinese exportsâ€”EVs, batteries, green tech, and strategic components.While the headlines focus on geopolitics, the ripple effect reaches deeper into Thailandâ€™s IT and tech economy.Hereâ€™s how:1. Pressure on Supply Chains = New IT DemandsWith higher costs on components and tech infrastructure sourced from China, Thai companies will need to:Reroute supply chainsReconfigure ERP systems and integrationsInvest in real-time data visibilityThis means rising demand for IT consultants, system architects, cloud migration experts, and cybersecurity pros.2. Shift in Manufacturing Strategy = Tech Talent OpportunitiesAs global firms look to move production out of China, Thailand becomes a prime alternative.Expect growth in:Smart factory initiativesIoT systems integrationLocal IT support for global firmsCompanies will need strong software developers, automation engineers, and DevOps professionals.3. Urgent Need for Scalable Tech InfrastructureBusiness continuity now depends on agility. From SMEs to conglomerates, Thai firms will need to upgrade:Cloud environmentsData analytics capabilitiesAI-assisted supply planningAt Nexmove, weâ€™re seeing the trend up closeâ€”our clients in manufacturing, logistics, and fintech are ramping up IT hiring, especially in roles related to supply chain resilience, system upgrades, and digital transformation.Thailandâ€™s IT ecosystem isnâ€™t isolated. Itâ€™s interconnected. And itâ€™s time to get ready.hashtag#ThailandTech hashtag#USChinaTrade hashtag#ITHiringThailand hashtag#TechJobsThailand hashtag#Nexmovejobs hashtag#SupplyChain

Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

DevOps and Cloud Labs is hiring for 2 DevOps and Cloud Engineers.To apply:- Please send your cv to rahulmagoo2003@gmail.com- Join WhatsApp Group : https://lnkd.in/gCBSPhUT- Reply a 1-2 line summary of your profile in comments so I can look at your profile. Include years of experience, and rate yourself in DevOps(x/10) and AWS(x/10) Azure(x/10).For shortlisted candidates, Interviews expected to be scheduled around 5 April onwards. Work experience letter will be provided as it is a full time position with an expected tenure of 6 months or more for the right candidate.- Remote WFH, flexible hours- DevOps knowledge- AWS/Azure knowledge. Any one cloud is enough.- Freshers with a work dedicated attitude and with basic DevOps/AWS knowledge are welcome to apply as well.Thank you for your interest.

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. HR Screening: Phone interview with basic technical questions (recorded for tech team review).2. Technical Interview: In-depth assessment with the tech team.---Why Join Us?Competitive salary and benefits.Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology in the cryptocurrency industry.Collaborative and innovative work environment.Career growth and professional development opportunities.CV send via email: lan.nguyen@metasolutions.software

The U.S. Just Hit China With New Tariffs. Why Should Thailandâ€™s IT Industry Care?This week, the U.S. rolled out fresh tariffs on key Chinese exportsâ€”EVs, batteries, green tech, and strategic components.While the headlines focus on geopolitics, the ripple effect reaches deeper into Thailandâ€™s IT and tech economy.Hereâ€™s how:1. Pressure on Supply Chains = New IT DemandsWith higher costs on components and tech infrastructure sourced from China, Thai companies will need to:Reroute supply chainsReconfigure ERP systems and integrationsInvest in real-time data visibilityThis means rising demand for IT consultants, system architects, cloud migration experts, and cybersecurity pros.2. Shift in Manufacturing Strategy = Tech Talent OpportunitiesAs global firms look to move production out of China, Thailand becomes a prime alternative.Expect growth in:Smart factory initiativesIoT systems integrationLocal IT support for global firmsCompanies will need strong software developers, automation engineers, and DevOps professionals.3. Urgent Need for Scalable Tech InfrastructureBusiness continuity now depends on agility. From SMEs to conglomerates, Thai firms will need to upgrade:Cloud environmentsData analytics capabilitiesAI-assisted supply planningAt Nexmove, weâ€™re seeing the trend up closeâ€”our clients in manufacturing, logistics, and fintech are ramping up IT hiring, especially in roles related to supply chain resilience, system upgrades, and digital transformation.Thailandâ€™s IT ecosystem isnâ€™t isolated. Itâ€™s interconnected. And itâ€™s time to get ready.hashtag#ThailandTech hashtag#USChinaTrade hashtag#ITHiringThailand hashtag#TechJobsThailand hashtag#Nexmovejobs hashtag#SupplyChain

Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

hashtag#hiring hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#canadianworkauthorizationJob Title: Java Full Stack DeveloperLocation: Montreal, QC (Hybrid)Experience: 7+ YearsValid Canadian work authorizationAbout the Role:We are seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Java-based server-side development and modern JavaScript frameworks for front-end development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing high-performance, scalable, and secure applications in a collaborative Agile environment. Key Responsibilities:Backend Development: Design and develop high-performance, low-latency applications using Java 8+, Spring Boot, and RESTful APIs.Build and maintain microservices-based architectures for scalable enterprise solutions.Optimize database queries for PostgreSQL, DB2, Oracle, or similar relational databases. Frontend Development: Develop responsive and interactive UI components using React.js, Angular, or Vue.js.Implement modern UI/UX practices with HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap. Collaboration & Agile Development: Work with architects, business analysts, and developers across global teams to deliver robust end-to-end solutions.Participate in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, retrospectives, and daily stand-ups.Conduct code reviews, unit testing, and integration testing to maintain high code quality. DevOps & Security: Enhance and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery.Ensure applications adhere to security best practices, scalability, and compliance standards.Monitor production environments, troubleshoot issues, and implement sustainable solutions. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Any one cloud is enough.- Freshers with a work dedicated attitude and with basic DevOps/AWS knowledge are welcome to apply as well.Thank you for your interest.

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. hashtag#hiring hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#canadianworkauthorizationJob Title: Java Full Stack DeveloperLocation: Montreal, QC (Hybrid)Experience: 7+ YearsValid Canadian work authorizationAbout the Role:We are seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Java-based server-side development and modern JavaScript frameworks for front-end development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing high-performance, scalable, and secure applications in a collaborative Agile environment. Key Responsibilities:Backend Development: Design and develop high-performance, low-latency applications using Java 8+, Spring Boot, and RESTful APIs.Build and maintain microservices-based architectures for scalable enterprise solutions.Optimize database queries for PostgreSQL, DB2, Oracle, or similar relational databases. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Any one cloud is enough.- Freshers with a work dedicated attitude and with basic DevOps/AWS knowledge are welcome to apply as well.Thank you for your interest.

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Any one cloud is enough.- Freshers with a work dedicated attitude and with basic DevOps/AWS knowledge are welcome to apply as well.Thank you for your interest.

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. In October of 2024, I made the decision to leave my job with the hope that a new chapter would begin quickly and that I had experience to fall back on. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. Please feel free to reach out or pass along any leads at any time, and share this post with anyone who might be able to help.I have experience in accounting, system administration (Windows, Linux), IT audit, and IT controls testing and compliance (SOX, SOC1, and SOC2, focusing on ERP Systems such as Oracle and SAP) at KPMG. Additionally, I am interested in exploring any junior DevOps roles, Cyber Threat Analyst roles, AML/KYC compliance analyst and financial analyst. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. In October of 2024, I made the decision to leave my job with the hope that a new chapter would begin quickly and that I had experience to fall back on. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. Please feel free to reach out or pass along any leads at any time, and share this post with anyone who might be able to help.I have experience in accounting, system administration (Windows, Linux), IT audit, and IT controls testing and compliance (SOX, SOC1, and SOC2, focusing on ERP Systems such as Oracle and SAP) at KPMG. Additionally, I am interested in exploring any junior DevOps roles, Cyber Threat Analyst roles, AML/KYC compliance analyst and financial analyst. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. The U.S. Just Hit China With New Tariffs. Why Should Thailandâ€™s IT Industry Care?This week, the U.S. rolled out fresh tariffs on key Chinese exportsâ€”EVs, batteries, green tech, and strategic components.While the headlines focus on geopolitics, the ripple effect reaches deeper into Thailandâ€™s IT and tech economy.Hereâ€™s how:1. Pressure on Supply Chains = New IT DemandsWith higher costs on components and tech infrastructure sourced from China, Thai companies will need to:Reroute supply chainsReconfigure ERP systems and integrationsInvest in real-time data visibilityThis means rising demand for IT consultants, system architects, cloud migration experts, and cybersecurity pros.2. Shift in Manufacturing Strategy = Tech Talent OpportunitiesAs global firms look to move production out of China, Thailand becomes a prime alternative.Expect growth in:Smart factory initiativesIoT systems integrationLocal IT support for global firmsCompanies will need strong software developers, automation engineers, and DevOps professionals.3. Urgent Need for Scalable Tech InfrastructureBusiness continuity now depends on agility. From SMEs to conglomerates, Thai firms will need to upgrade:Cloud environmentsData analytics capabilitiesAI-assisted supply planningAt Nexmove, weâ€™re seeing the trend up closeâ€”our clients in manufacturing, logistics, and fintech are ramping up IT hiring, especially in roles related to supply chain resilience, system upgrades, and digital transformation.Thailandâ€™s IT ecosystem isnâ€™t isolated. hashtag#hiring hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#canadianworkauthorizationJob Title: Java Full Stack DeveloperLocation: Montreal, QC (Hybrid)Experience: 7+ YearsValid Canadian work authorizationAbout the Role:We are seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Java-based server-side development and modern JavaScript frameworks for front-end development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing high-performance, scalable, and secure applications in a collaborative Agile environment. Key Responsibilities:Backend Development: Design and develop high-performance, low-latency applications using Java 8+, Spring Boot, and RESTful APIs.Build and maintain microservices-based architectures for scalable enterprise solutions.Optimize database queries for PostgreSQL, DB2, Oracle, or similar relational databases. Frontend Development: Develop responsive and interactive UI components using React.js, Angular, or Vue.js.Implement modern UI/UX practices with HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap. Collaboration & Agile Development: Work with architects, business analysts, and developers across global teams to deliver robust end-to-end solutions.Participate in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, retrospectives, and daily stand-ups.Conduct code reviews, unit testing, and integration testing to maintain high code quality. DevOps & Security: Enhance and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery.Ensure applications adhere to security best practices, scalability, and compliance standards.Monitor production environments, troubleshoot issues, and implement sustainable solutions. Required Skills & Experience:Backend: Java 8+ | Spring Boot | REST APIs | MicroservicesFrontend: JavaScript | TypeScript | React.js | Angular | Vue.js | HTML5 | CSS3 | BootstrapDatabases: PostgreSQL | DB2 | Oracle (Experience with writing optimized queries)Version Control & Build Tools: Git | Maven | GradleAgile Development: Experience with JIRA & ConfluenceExcellent Communication & Teamwork: Ability to collaborate in a globally distributed team Nice to Have (Preferred Skills):NoSQL Databases: Experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL solutionsCloud Technologies: Exposure to Azure (or other cloud platforms)DevOps & Containers: Experience with Docker/Kubernetes, Jenkins, GitLab CIMessaging & Security: Familiarity with Kafka, OAuth2/JWT, Enterprise Security ModelsPerformance Optimization: Strong understanding of memory management and performance tuning for enterprise applicationsEligible candidates can email to shua.ahmed@cbwci.ca

Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Any one cloud is enough.- Freshers with a work dedicated attitude and with basic DevOps/AWS knowledge are welcome to apply as well.Thank you for your interest.

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. In October of 2024, I made the decision to leave my job with the hope that a new chapter would begin quickly and that I had experience to fall back on. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. Additionally, I am interested in exploring any junior DevOps roles, Cyber Threat Analyst roles, AML/KYC compliance analyst and financial analyst. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. Support GSDin projects through the complete life-cycle including scoping, planning, executing, implementing/rollout, and closing.Collaborate with program managers or lead efforts toÂ support in monitoringÂ project activities  Tech Skills ( Infrastructure)  Experience withÂ deploying Cloud landing Zone on Google Cloud Platform.Experience with using Google Cloud Landing Zone Foundation ToolkitÂ or Fast Fabric.Experience with Ansible modules for managing various infrastructure components (e.g., servers, networks, databases).Ability to design, develop, and maintain Ansible playbooks and roles for consistent and repeatable deployments.Experience withÂ developing GCPÂ infrastructure services using TerraformÂ following all Googleâ€™s Guiding principles.Be able to perform Terraform coding/ scriptingÂ independently.Experience in reviewing and validating runbooks for accuracy, completeness, and adherence to established standards.Experience in developing and implementing DR strategies to ensure business continuity, Knowledge of various DR techniques, including backup and restore, replication, and failover.Ability to assess business requirements and determine appropriate DR strategies and classifications. Understanding of recovery time objectives (RTOs) and recovery point objectives (RPOs).Experience in conducting risk assessments and business impact analyses to inform DR planning.Experience with deploying & setting up services such as Google Cloud Operations suite.Experience with DevOps Practices and familiar with deploying end to end CI/CD pipelines using tools such as Cloud Build, or Github Actions or any other similar tools.hashtag#interested candidates can share CV to APACRec07@itconnectus.com

Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher
