Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. In October of 2024, I made the decision to leave my job with the hope that a new chapter would begin quickly and that I had experience to fall back on. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. Please feel free to reach out or pass along any leads at any time, and share this post with anyone who might be able to help.I have experience in accounting, system administration (Windows, Linux), IT audit, and IT controls testing and compliance (SOX, SOC1, and SOC2, focusing on ERP Systems such as Oracle and SAP) at KPMG. Additionally, I am interested in exploring any junior DevOps roles, Cyber Threat Analyst roles, AML/KYC compliance analyst and financial analyst. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. Cheers,Slavaslava.career@outlook.com | +1(347)476-4846hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#ITJobs hashtag#OpenToWork hashtag#Careers hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#CyberSecurity hashtag#Compliance hashtag#USAJobs hashtag#NYCJobs hashtag#AccountingJobs hashtag#ITAudit hashtag#InternalAudit hashtag#Big4

The U.S. Just Hit China With New Tariffs. Why Should Thailandâ€™s IT Industry Care?This week, the U.S. rolled out fresh tariffs on key Chinese exportsâ€”EVs, batteries, green tech, and strategic components.While the headlines focus on geopolitics, the ripple effect reaches deeper into Thailandâ€™s IT and tech economy.Hereâ€™s how:1. Pressure on Supply Chains = New IT DemandsWith higher costs on components and tech infrastructure sourced from China, Thai companies will need to:Reroute supply chainsReconfigure ERP systems and integrationsInvest in real-time data visibilityThis means rising demand for IT consultants, system architects, cloud migration experts, and cybersecurity pros.2. Shift in Manufacturing Strategy = Tech Talent OpportunitiesAs global firms look to move production out of China, Thailand becomes a prime alternative.Expect growth in:Smart factory initiativesIoT systems integrationLocal IT support for global firmsCompanies will need strong software developers, automation engineers, and DevOps professionals.3. Urgent Need for Scalable Tech InfrastructureBusiness continuity now depends on agility. From SMEs to conglomerates, Thai firms will need to upgrade:Cloud environmentsData analytics capabilitiesAI-assisted supply planningAt Nexmove, weâ€™re seeing the trend up closeâ€”our clients in manufacturing, logistics, and fintech are ramping up IT hiring, especially in roles related to supply chain resilience, system upgrades, and digital transformation.Thailandâ€™s IT ecosystem isnâ€™t isolated. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. In October of 2024, I made the decision to leave my job with the hope that a new chapter would begin quickly and that I had experience to fall back on. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. Please feel free to reach out or pass along any leads at any time, and share this post with anyone who might be able to help.I have experience in accounting, system administration (Windows, Linux), IT audit, and IT controls testing and compliance (SOX, SOC1, and SOC2, focusing on ERP Systems such as Oracle and SAP) at KPMG. Additionally, I am interested in exploring any junior DevOps roles, Cyber Threat Analyst roles, AML/KYC compliance analyst and financial analyst. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. hashtag#hiring hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#canadianworkauthorizationJob Title: Java Full Stack DeveloperLocation: Montreal, QC (Hybrid)Experience: 7+ YearsValid Canadian work authorizationAbout the Role:We are seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Java-based server-side development and modern JavaScript frameworks for front-end development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing high-performance, scalable, and secure applications in a collaborative Agile environment. Key Responsibilities:Backend Development: Design and develop high-performance, low-latency applications using Java 8+, Spring Boot, and RESTful APIs.Build and maintain microservices-based architectures for scalable enterprise solutions.Optimize database queries for PostgreSQL, DB2, Oracle, or similar relational databases. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Any one cloud is enough.- Freshers with a work dedicated attitude and with basic DevOps/AWS knowledge are welcome to apply as well.Thank you for your interest.

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. In October of 2024, I made the decision to leave my job with the hope that a new chapter would begin quickly and that I had experience to fall back on. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. Please feel free to reach out or pass along any leads at any time, and share this post with anyone who might be able to help.I have experience in accounting, system administration (Windows, Linux), IT audit, and IT controls testing and compliance (SOX, SOC1, and SOC2, focusing on ERP Systems such as Oracle and SAP) at KPMG. Additionally, I am interested in exploring any junior DevOps roles, Cyber Threat Analyst roles, AML/KYC compliance analyst and financial analyst. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. hashtag#hiring hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#canadianworkauthorizationJob Title: Java Full Stack DeveloperLocation: Montreal, QC (Hybrid)Experience: 7+ YearsValid Canadian work authorizationAbout the Role:We are seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Java-based server-side development and modern JavaScript frameworks for front-end development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing high-performance, scalable, and secure applications in a collaborative Agile environment. Key Responsibilities:Backend Development: Design and develop high-performance, low-latency applications using Java 8+, Spring Boot, and RESTful APIs.Build and maintain microservices-based architectures for scalable enterprise solutions.Optimize database queries for PostgreSQL, DB2, Oracle, or similar relational databases. Frontend Development: Develop responsive and interactive UI components using React.js, Angular, or Vue.js.Implement modern UI/UX practices with HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Any one cloud is enough.- Freshers with a work dedicated attitude and with basic DevOps/AWS knowledge are welcome to apply as well.Thank you for your interest.

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. In October of 2024, I made the decision to leave my job with the hope that a new chapter would begin quickly and that I had experience to fall back on. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. Please feel free to reach out or pass along any leads at any time, and share this post with anyone who might be able to help.I have experience in accounting, system administration (Windows, Linux), IT audit, and IT controls testing and compliance (SOX, SOC1, and SOC2, focusing on ERP Systems such as Oracle and SAP) at KPMG. Additionally, I am interested in exploring any junior DevOps roles, Cyber Threat Analyst roles, AML/KYC compliance analyst and financial analyst. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. Familiarity with containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes). Understanding of Azure security, networking, and compliance. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. In October of 2024, I made the decision to leave my job with the hope that a new chapter would begin quickly and that I had experience to fall back on. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. Please feel free to reach out or pass along any leads at any time, and share this post with anyone who might be able to help.I have experience in accounting, system administration (Windows, Linux), IT audit, and IT controls testing and compliance (SOX, SOC1, and SOC2, focusing on ERP Systems such as Oracle and SAP) at KPMG. Additionally, I am interested in exploring any junior DevOps roles, Cyber Threat Analyst roles, AML/KYC compliance analyst and financial analyst. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. Weâ€™re hashtag#Hiring hashtag#AutomationTestEngineer with (hashtag#APiTesting, hashtag#UITesting & On-prem to Azure Cloud) - Onsite Opportunity LA, CA. This is a long term contract position. If you're interested, please share your resume to sameer.kumar@meridianit.com  Job Title: Automation Test Engineer (APi Testing, UI Testing & On-Prem to Azure Cloud Migration) Location: Los Angeles, CA (Onsite) Duration: Long Term Contract  Job Description: We are seeking a skilled Automation Test Engineer with experience in on-prem to Azure cloud migration. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing automated test scripts to ensure seamless cloud migration and application stability. This role requires a strong background in test automation frameworks, cloud technologies (Azure), and CI/CD processes.  Key Responsibilities: Design and implement automated test scripts for applications migrating from on-premises to Azure Cloud. Develop and maintain test frameworks using tools like Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, or TestNG. Validate cloud migration activities, ensuring data integrity, performance, and security compliance. Conduct API testing using tools such as Postman, RestAssured, or SoapUI. Perform load, stress, and performance testing to evaluate application behavior post-migration. Work closely with DevOps, development, and cloud teams to integrate testing into CI/CD pipelines. Monitor and analyze test results, identifying defects and working with developers to resolve issues. Ensure adherence to Azure security and compliance standards during testing. Automate infrastructure and environment testing using Terraform, ARM templates, or Azure DevOps. Document test cases, test plans, and generate detailed reports on test execution results.  Required Skills: 10+ years of experience in automation testing. Expertise in test automation tools (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, TestNG, etc.). Strong knowledge of Azure Cloud services (VMs, Storage, Functions, AKS, etc.). Experience with API testing using Postman, RestAssured, or similar tools. Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions). Knowledge of performance testing using JMeter, LoadRunner, or similar tools. Experience in scripting languages (Python, Java, JavaScript, or C#). Familiarity with containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes). Understanding of Azure security, networking, and compliance. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in an agile environment. hashtag#C2Chashtag#Vendorshashtag#Thirdpartyhashtag#SDETUSAhashtag#LAcandidateshashtag#Resumeshashtag#corptocorphashtag#Jobshashtag#jobhashtag#HiringinLosAngeleshashtag#partners

Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. If you're interested, please share your resume to sameer.kumar@meridianit.com  Job Title: Automation Test Engineer (APi Testing, UI Testing & On-Prem to Azure Cloud Migration) Location: Los Angeles, CA (Onsite) Duration: Long Term Contract  Job Description: We are seeking a skilled Automation Test Engineer with experience in on-prem to Azure cloud migration. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing automated test scripts to ensure seamless cloud migration and application stability. This role requires a strong background in test automation frameworks, cloud technologies (Azure), and CI/CD processes. Experience with API testing using Postman, RestAssured, or similar tools. Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions). Knowledge of performance testing using JMeter, LoadRunner, or similar tools. Experience in scripting languages (Python, Java, JavaScript, or C#). Familiarity with containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes). Understanding of Azure security, networking, and compliance. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. HR Screening: Phone interview with basic technical questions (recorded for tech team review).2. Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. In October of 2024, I made the decision to leave my job with the hope that a new chapter would begin quickly and that I had experience to fall back on. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. Please feel free to reach out or pass along any leads at any time, and share this post with anyone who might be able to help.I have experience in accounting, system administration (Windows, Linux), IT audit, and IT controls testing and compliance (SOX, SOC1, and SOC2, focusing on ERP Systems such as Oracle and SAP) at KPMG. Additionally, I am interested in exploring any junior DevOps roles, Cyber Threat Analyst roles, AML/KYC compliance analyst and financial analyst. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. If you're interested, please share your resume to sameer.kumar@meridianit.com  Job Title: Automation Test Engineer (APi Testing, UI Testing & On-Prem to Azure Cloud Migration) Location: Los Angeles, CA (Onsite) Duration: Long Term Contract  Job Description: We are seeking a skilled Automation Test Engineer with experience in on-prem to Azure cloud migration. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing automated test scripts to ensure seamless cloud migration and application stability. This role requires a strong background in test automation frameworks, cloud technologies (Azure), and CI/CD processes.  Key Responsibilities: Design and implement automated test scripts for applications migrating from on-premises to Azure Cloud. Develop and maintain test frameworks using tools like Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, or TestNG. Validate cloud migration activities, ensuring data integrity, performance, and security compliance. Conduct API testing using tools such as Postman, RestAssured, or SoapUI. Perform load, stress, and performance testing to evaluate application behavior post-migration. Work closely with DevOps, development, and cloud teams to integrate testing into CI/CD pipelines. Monitor and analyze test results, identifying defects and working with developers to resolve issues. Ensure adherence to Azure security and compliance standards during testing. Automate infrastructure and environment testing using Terraform, ARM templates, or Azure DevOps. Document test cases, test plans, and generate detailed reports on test execution results.  Required Skills: 10+ years of experience in automation testing. Expertise in test automation tools (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, TestNG, etc.). Strong knowledge of Azure Cloud services (VMs, Storage, Functions, AKS, etc.). Experience with API testing using Postman, RestAssured, or similar tools. Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions). Knowledge of performance testing using JMeter, LoadRunner, or similar tools. Experience in scripting languages (Python, Java, JavaScript, or C#). Familiarity with containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes). Understanding of Azure security, networking, and compliance. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Java EngineerLocation: Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh CityExperience: 4+ yearsSalary: Open to discuss (40,000,000 - 60,000,000 VND NET/monthly)---Key ResponsibilitiesLead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and high-performance backend systems.Design and build RESTful APIs to integrate with the frontend and third-party services.Manage large databases to ensure efficient and secure data storage and retrieval.Conduct performance testing and optimization to ensure system stability and scalability.Collaborate with QA and Product teams to analyze requirements and propose technical solutions.Integrate and manage third-party and AI KYC services (e.g., Onfido, Jumio).Ensure compliance with security standards and legal regulations regarding customer data.---Job RequirementsMust-have:4+ years of experience in backend development using Java (Spring/Spring Boot).Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and microservices architecture.Experience working with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis).Familiarity with KYC regulations and data security best practices.Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar).Experience deploying systems on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Nice-to-have:Experience integrating third-party KYC services.Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth2, JWT, or SAML.Familiarity with message queue systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).Experience with DevOps tools like Docker/Kubernetes.---Interview Process2 Rounds:1. If you're interested, please share your resume to sameer.kumar@meridianit.com  Job Title: Automation Test Engineer (APi Testing, UI Testing & On-Prem to Azure Cloud Migration) Location: Los Angeles, CA (Onsite) Duration: Long Term Contract  Job Description: We are seeking a skilled Automation Test Engineer with experience in on-prem to Azure cloud migration. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing automated test scripts to ensure seamless cloud migration and application stability. This role requires a strong background in test automation frameworks, cloud technologies (Azure), and CI/CD processes. Scenario-based Linux Interview Questions Part 2 ğŸ˜ŠNetworking & Connectivity1. Network Down: Your server has lost network connectivity. How do you troubleshoot?2. High Latency Issues: Users report slow connections to the server. How do you diagnose the issue?3. Port in Use: A service cannot start because the port is already in use. How do you find and free the port?4. IP Conflict: Two machines are experiencing connectivity issues due to an IP conflict. How do you resolve it?5. Firewall Issues: A service is running, but it's unreachable. How do you check and fix firewall rules?6. DNS Resolution Failure: How do you diagnose and fix DNS resolution issues?7. Network Bandwidth Consumption: How do you find which process or user is consuming the most bandwidth?8. Persistent Network Configuration: How do you set a static IP address on a Linux server?9. Multiple Network Interfaces: How do you configure Linux to use a specific network interface for outbound traffic?10. Packet Loss Diagnosis: How do you debug and fix network packet loss?Security & Access Control11. Account Locked Due to Too Many Login Attempts: How do you unlock a locked user account?12. Suspicious Login Activity: How do you check and block unauthorized login attempts?13. SSH Key Authentication Not Working: A user cannot log in via SSH keys. How do you fix it?14. Firewall Blocking Application Traffic: How do you check if iptables or firewalld is blocking a service?15. Find and Stop Unauthorized Background Processes: How do you identify and kill suspicious processes running in the background?16. Service Running as Root Instead of a Non-privileged User: How do you fix it?17. How to Secure a Linux Server from Brute Force Attacks?18. Password Expiry Policy Enforcement: How do you enforce password expiration for all users?19. Monitoring File Changes for Security Audits: How do you track changes in critical configuration files?20. Limiting User Access to Certain Commands: How do you restrict sudo access for specific commands?Performance & Optimization21. Server Running Out of Memory Frequently: How do you troubleshoot and optimize memory usage?22. Application Experiencing High Disk Latency: How do you diagnose and resolve disk I/O bottlenecks?23. CPU Usage Spikes at Regular Intervals: How do you analyze and fix periodic CPU spikes?24. Linux System Freezing Randomly: How do you debug and find the root cause?25. Optimizing System for High-performance Computing: What kernel tuning parameters would you adjust?26. Troubleshooting Slow Application Response Times: How do you identify and fix the issue?27. Swap Usage is Always High Even When RAM is Available: How do you investigate and optimize swap usage?Follow Jatin Bansal hashtag#Like | hashtag#Comment | hashtag#Share | hashtag#Reposthashtag#linux hashtag#devops hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#sysadmin hashtag#fresher

Hello everyone,I wanted to reach out to my network as I am actively looking for new opportunities in any field. In October of 2024, I made the decision to leave my job with the hope that a new chapter would begin quickly and that I had experience to fall back on. Soon after, I explored an international outsourcing business opportunity while actively applying for remote jobs. The business opportunity I was working on has currently stalled and is not my prime focus at the moment. The job market has proven to be more challenging than I expected, and I continue to receive automated rejections for multiple IT jobs for which I am qualified, including entry-level positions. If you are aware of any opportunities, know someone who is hiring, or could provide a reference within your firm, I would greatly appreciate the chance to briefly touch base. Please feel free to reach out or pass along any leads at any time, and share this post with anyone who might be able to help.I have experience in accounting, system administration (Windows, Linux), IT audit, and IT controls testing and compliance (SOX, SOC1, and SOC2, focusing on ERP Systems such as Oracle and SAP) at KPMG. Additionally, I am interested in exploring any junior DevOps roles, Cyber Threat Analyst roles, AML/KYC compliance analyst and financial analyst. I am CPA eligible and also planning to complete CISSP by June 2025.I am NOT seeking solely remote opportunities; I am open to any full-time (in person), freelance or contract roles and am able to relocate anywhere in North America, given an appropriate salary to justify the move. Can work 7 days per week and have no external obligations other than finding immediate employment. I am based in the NYC metro area but will consider discussing any opportunity. Thank you for your attention, and I hope to connect soon. Work closely with DevOps, development, and cloud teams to integrate testing into CI/CD pipelines. Monitor and analyze test results, identifying defects and working with developers to resolve issues. Ensure adherence to Azure security and compliance standards during testing. Automate infrastructure and environment testing using Terraform, ARM templates, or Azure DevOps. Expertise in test automation tools (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, TestNG, etc.). Strong knowledge of Azure Cloud services (VMs, Storage, Functions, AKS, etc.). Experience with API testing using Postman, RestAssured, or similar tools. Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions). Knowledge of performance testing using JMeter, LoadRunner, or similar tools. Experience in scripting languages (Python, Java, JavaScript, or C#). Familiarity with containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes). Understanding of Azure security, networking, and compliance.
